DataElement.preferredName: PET Imaging Agent Radiopharmaceutical Purity Test Not Done Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The outcome of a laboratory test used to determine the degree a radioactive form of glucose is free of contaminants._a single character text field to record data.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PET Imaging Agent Radiopharmaceutical Purity Test Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The outcome of a laboratory test used to determine the degree a radioactive form of glucose is free of contaminants.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:A compound that enables or improves the visualization of body structures or functions for medical imaging.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
A compound that enables or improves the visualization of body structures or functions for medical imaging.

Property.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:A quantitative assessment of the homogeneity or uniformity of a mixture. Alternatively, purity refers to the degree of being free of contaminants or heterogeneous components.:The outcome of a laboratory test.

Concepts.definition: An agent that contains a radioactive isotope and is used for diagnostic or therapeutic purposes.
A quantitative assessment of the homogeneity or uniformity of a mixture. Alternatively, purity refers to the degree of being free of contaminants or heterogeneous components.
The outcome of a laboratory test.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
